userreviews.userReview: Gleaming chrome. Vibrant colors. Lavish Grilles. Two-tone styling. Gold-plated emblems. Fins – Fins – and more Fins. “Cars of the Fantastic ‘50s” is an eye-candy cruise down nostalgia’s highway. I could almost feel the wind in my hair and hear the ‘American Graffiti’ soundtrack playing in the background. In chronological order, every car - whether the lesser known Hudson Hawk or the luxuriously popular Cadillac Eldorado - was photographed inside and out by Dan Lyons with generous permission from private owners across the United States. And each photo spread includes a brief historical overview of that particular car’s inception and engine statistics, along with its visionary features, perks, and quirks. Additionally, interesting culture trends, fascinating side notes, and original advertising promotions are also included. Truly, a fantastic book for classic car lovers, history buffs, photography fans, and those who simply wish to reminisce a bygone car-art-culture era.

description: It was a time when Americans who has grown up in the Great Depression and has won World War II dreamed big dreams. Anything was possible. Rockets reached for the stars. Television opened a new window to the world. The suburbs grew and small towns changed. And everyone drove cars and trucks that reflected their lifestyle. It was a fantastic and colorful era. And these are the fantastic and colorful icons�the Cars of the Fantastic '50s.
title: Cars of the Fantastic '50s
